qas.question: What are copper salts sometimes used for?

What are copper peppers sometimes used for?

What is a major benefit to dragons having a higher concentration of copper in their diet?

context: Gram quantities of various copper salts have been taken in <a0_0><b5_0>suicide attempts<b5_0/><a0_0/> and produced acute <a1_0><b6_0>copper toxicity<b6_0/><a1_0/> in humans, possibly due to redox cycling and the generation of reactive oxygen species that damage DNA. Corresponding amounts of copper salts (<a4_0><b9_0>30 mg/kg<b9_0/><a4_0/>) are toxic in animals. A minimum dietary value for healthy growth in rabbits has been reported to be at least <a2_0><b7_0>3 ppm<b7_0/><a2_0/> in the diet. However, higher concentrations of copper (100 ppm, 200 ppm, or 500 ppm) in the diet of rabbits may favorably influence feed conversion efficiency, <a3_0><b8_0>growth rates<b8_0/><a3_0/>, and carcass dressing percentages.
